messages.content: You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the focus of the European funded research project mentioned by Professor Eric Atwell?
The focus of the European funded research project is on looking into the use of chatbots in higher education.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some examples of rule-based chatbots mentioned in the lecture?
ELIZA, PARRY, ALICE, Hubert
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is one way to train corpus-based chatbots?
Using a corpus to train via some sort of machine learning
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the difference between conversational and dialogue in the context of chatbots?
Conversational sounds more like chat, whereas dialogue is more like interaction to some purpose.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some examples of tasks that smart systems like Alexa are good at?
Some examples of tasks that smart systems like Alexa are good at include playing music and setting timers.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some of the functions that Alexa can perform?

Alexa can perform tasks such as telling jokes, booking travel reservations, ordering items, shopping via Amazon, answering general knowledge questions, and providing information sourced from Google or Wikipedia.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are the two kinds of chatbots mentioned in the lecture segment?
The two kinds of chatbots mentioned are chatting conversational agents and chatbots used for keeping transcripts for analysis and diagnosis.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some examples of tasks that formal targeted task-based dialogue agents can perform?
Some examples of tasks that formal targeted task-based dialogue agents can perform include booking flights, booking restaurants, buying things via Amazon, and interfaces to personal assistants.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are the two types of chatbot architectures mentioned in the lecture?
The two types of chatbot architectures mentioned are rule-based systems and task-based systems.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
How does machine learning from a corpus work in the context of question answering systems?

Machine learning from a corpus involves extracting rules from a training corpus and matching user input against a set of patterns to find the best match, which corresponds to a specific action. In question answering systems, the pattern can be a question type and the action will be an answer.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the Turing test and how did PARRY perform on it?

The Turing test is a test where human judges decide if they're conversing with an AI agent or a real person. PARRY's responses, based on its mental model and state of mind, were so convincing that psychologists examining its transcripts couldn't distinguish if it was a human or a chatbot, suggesting that PARRY passed the Turing test.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are the two alternative approaches mentioned for finding the best match in information retrieval?
The two alternative approaches mentioned are encoding the input into a vector and finding the most similar vector using information retrieval techniques, or using deep learning neural models.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the main difference between information retrieval and database querying?

The main difference is that in information retrieval, you type in some keywords and get the documents you want, whereas in database querying using SQL, you type in some keywords and get the structured data you want.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the main focus of Tom Pickard's research at the University of Leeds?
The main focus of Tom Pickard's research at the University of Leeds is the EDUBOTS project, which looks at chatbots and conversational AI in higher education.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is a Multi Word Expression (MWE) according to the lecture?
A Multi Word Expression is a group of more than one word which functions linguistically as a single unit of meaning.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the term used to describe the phenomenon of thinking of a witty comeback too late, as mentioned in the lecture?
l'espirit d'escalier
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What percentage of the entries in WordNet consist of more than one word?
Up to about half, depending on who you ask and when they go and look.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is one of the properties that Multi Word Expressions have?
One of the properties that Multi Word Expressions have is non-compositionality.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
According to the lecture, what is the difference between expressions like 'Iron Curtain' and 'swimming pool' in terms of understanding them?

Expressions like 'Iron Curtain' are very opaque and almost impossible to understand without extra context, even if you know the individual words, while expressions like 'swimming pool' are easier to understand as long as you know the meanings of the individual words.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the Sketch Engine web tool used for?
The Sketch Engine web tool is used for text analytics and corpus linguistics research.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is Sketch Engine and how can Leeds University researchers access it?
Sketch Engine is an online tool founded by Adam Kilgarriff. It is a commercial service, but Leeds University researchers currently have free access to it.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the purpose of a concordance in linguistic analysis?
A concordance shows examples of a particular word, lemma, or phrase that appears repeatedly in a corpus, providing examples of its use in context.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is WebBootCaT and how can it be used in creating a specialised corpus?

WebBootCaT is a special tool for creating a specialised corpus of your own choice from the web. It can be used to extract words and multi-word terms which are characteristic of the corpus, likely specialist terms.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
According to the lecture, how is the evaluation of a language model with n-gram probability estimates typically done?
One way to evaluate a language model with n-gram probability estimates is to measure perplexity of the language model against a corpus.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some techniques to deal with the issue of having no examples of a word in the training set?
Some techniques to deal with this issue include smoothing, such as add-one smoothing or Laplace smoothing, and combining n-gram models by interpolation.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Who is the professor mentioned in the lecture as the developer of the CAMeL lab at New York University, Abu Dhabi?
Professor Nizar Habash
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the main focus of Google Translate's language models?
Google Translate's language models are developed to work in general with text in multiple languages and alphabets, rather than focusing on specific languages like English, Chinese, or Hindi.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the World Mapper project mentioned in the lecture?

The World Mapper project is a research project at Leeds University that draws maps of the world where each country is morphed by a specific feature or statistic, such as the number of Arabic speakers in that country.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Who is the lecturer for the data mining and text analytics module at the University of Leeds?
Professor Eric Atwell
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some of the research areas that Professor Eric Atwell is involved in?

Professor Eric Atwell is involved in research areas such as corpus linguistics, artificial intelligence for language, religious text analytics, Arabic and Islamic corpus linguistics, chat bots, and AI for university education.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are the six units covered in the overall module?

The six units covered in the overall module are: 1) Introduction to Corpus linguistics, text analytics, and sketch engine. 2) Data about text data mining and the tool Weka. 3) Analysis of the meanings of words and text. 4) Tagging of text and practical applications scaling to large data sets.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some examples of text analytics mentioned in the lecture?
Some examples of text analytics mentioned in the lecture include machine translation, information extraction, chat bots, and BERT.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Who are the authors of the textbook Speech and Language Processing?
Dan Jurafsky and James Martin
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the topic of the lecture by Professor Eric Atwell?
The topic of the lecture by Professor Eric Atwell is word embeddings or meanings and vector semantics.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is a word embedding in natural language processing?

A word embedding is a term used to represent the word meaning for text analysis, typically a real valued vector that encodes the meaning of a word such that words closer in vector space are similar in meaning.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some ways to make vectors more realistic in text analysis?
Some ways to make vectors more realistic in text analysis include using TFIDF, term frequency divided by document frequency, pointwise mutual information, and word2vec.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Why does having different strings for 'class' and 'classes' mean they have different meanings?
Having different strings for 'class' and 'classes' means they are treated as separate entities in the computer's memory, leading to different meanings.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some examples given in the lecture of applications of AI?
The examples given in the lecture are non-representation module, machine learning and deep learning module, and philosophical logic.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
According to the lecture, what was linguist Barbara Partee's joke about the meaning of life?
Barbara Partee's joke about the meaning of life was that it is spelled as L-I-F-E.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
In the context of the lecture segment, what is a desiderate?
A desiderate is a Latin word meaning 'things that are desirable.'
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the purpose of part of speech tagging in text analytics?
The purpose of part of speech tagging is to add to every word in a text its part of speech.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the focus of the lecture by Professor Eric Atwell?
The focus of the lecture by Professor Eric Atwell is on text classification, specifically on the Naive Bayes classifier.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is being discussed in the lecture segment?

The lecture segment is discussing sentiment analysis, specifically looking at Native Bayes and its similarity to Markov or N-gram language modeling, as well as the evaluation of sentiment classification.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some measures other than accuracy that can be used to evaluate classification models?
Precision, recall, and F measure
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
How did J. Madison and Hamilton try to persuade people to join the United States?
They wrote letters or papers.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
How did Mosteller and Wallace analyze the disputed letters to predict the authors?
Mosteller and Wallace used Bayesian mathematics to analyze the texts and try to predict which of the three classes, in this case the authors, applied for these 12 letters.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the focus of Unit 1, part 1.1 in the module?
The focus of Unit 1, part 1.1 is on the background and practical applications of corpus linguistics and text analytics.

What topics are covered in Week 5 of the module on text analytics?
Machine Translation, Information Extraction, and Python tools for text analytics
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the title of the book by Witten, Frank, Hall, and Pal that is mentioned in the lecture?
Data Mining: Practical machine learning tools and techniques
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are the six phases of the CRISP-DM modelling process in the context of Data Mining?
The six phases of the CRISP-DM modelling process in Data Mining are: Business Understanding, Data Understanding, Data Preparation, Modeling, Evaluation, and Deployment.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some of the academic disciplines highlighted in the book regarding speech and language technology?
Some of the academic disciplines highlighted in the book include Linguistics, Phonetics, Lexicography, and Syntax.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some key topics covered in the lecture on Information Retrieval?

Some key topics covered in the lecture on Information Retrieval include Google search, Inverted file for efficient match, Boolean set theoretic model, weighted vector model, Worked examples, Evaluation, Query broadening to improve matching, and the problem of finding strings in a database.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the purpose of the given SQL query?
The purpose of the SQL query is to find all modules that match the terms 'database', 'AI', or 'knowledge base'.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Why will the given SQL query not match any record?
The SQL query will not match any record because the condition 't.value = database AND t.value = AI AND t.value = knowledge base' cannot be simultaneously true for any record in the database.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the main difference between Information Extraction (IE) and Information Retrieval (IR)?

The main difference is that IR pulls documents from large text collections in response to specific keywords or queries, while IE pulls facts and structured information (Named Entities and Relations) from the content of large text collections.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
When would you use Information Extraction (IE)?

Information Extraction (IE) would be used when you need to extract knowledge at a deeper level than Information Retrieval (IR), such as constructing a database through IE and linking it back to the documents to provide a valuable alternative search tool.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the aim of the HaSIE application mentioned in the lecture segment?
The aim of the HaSIE application is to find out how companies report about health and safety information.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is Named Entity Recognition?

Named Entity Recognition is a process where a system identifies relevant sections of each document, pulls out sentences about specific entities, such as health and safety issues, and populates a database with this information.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Why is Named Entity Recognition (NER) important?

NER provides a foundation from which to build more complex Information Extraction (IE) systems. Relations between Named Entities (NEs) can provide tracking, ontological information, and scenario building.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some examples of ambiguity in Named Entity (NE) types mentioned in the lecture?
Some examples of ambiguity in NE types mentioned are: John Smith (company vs. person), June (person vs. month), Washington (person vs. location), and 1945 (date vs. time).
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some advantages and disadvantages of the shallow parsing approach?

Advantages include being simple, fast, language independent, and easy to retarget by creating new lists. Disadvantages include the collection and maintenance of lists, inability to deal with name variants, and inability to resolve ambiguity.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is BERT and what is it used for?
BERT is a method and toolkit from Google Labs for understanding meaning relationships between sentences, and is used in tasks which involve measuring meaning similarity between sentences.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some of the challenges in Machine Translation mentioned in the lecture?

Some of the challenges in Machine Translation mentioned in the lecture include complex orthography, lexical ambiguity, morphological complexity and variation, tokenization issues, and translation divergences.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Why is it important to have a parallel corpus with source and target sentences aligned for machine translation?

It is important to have a parallel corpus with source and target sentences aligned for machine translation in order to train translation models effectively by having corresponding sentences in different languages for comparison and learning.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is GIZA++ and how is it used in statistical machine translation?
GIZA++ is a statistical machine translation toolkit used to train word alignments.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some advantages of Phrase-Based Statistical Machine Translation (SMT)?

Some advantages of Phrase-Based SMT include many-to-many mappings for non-compositional phrases, the use of local context for disambiguation, and the ability to handle longer learned phrases with more data.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the purpose of the Bleu Metric in automatic evaluation of machine translation?
The purpose of the Bleu Metric is to compare machine translation output against several human translations to give a standardized score that correlates highly with human evaluation.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Where can Artificial Intelligence experts join social media communities for networking, sharing knowledge, and getting ideas for research projects?

Artificial Intelligence experts can join social media communities like Facebook, LinkedIn, Quora, as well as communities set up by/for academics and practitioners such as KDnuggets, Kaggle, Weka, ICAME, ACL, SemEval, and EU-JRC communities.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some of the subsidiaries of the parent organization mentioned in the lecture?
Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is a knowledge nugget according to the lecture material?
A knowledge nugget is a small item or piece of useful knowledge in categories of interest to the user.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What platform offers a customizable Jupyter Notebooks environment, access to free GPUs, and a large repository of community published data & code?
Kaggle offers a no-setup, customizable, Jupyter Notebooks environment. Access free GPUs and a huge repository of community published data & code.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the purpose of the WEKA software mentioned in the lecture segment?

The purpose of WEKA is to provide a platform for knowledge analysis and is a hub for users to access downloads, textbooks, tutorials, and contribution add-ons in a more open and community-based environment.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What areas of expertise are involved in the HUMAINT project?
The areas of expertise involved in the HUMAINT project include cognitive science, machine learning, human-computer interaction, and economy.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What method was used by Mosteller and Wallace to determine the authorship of the disputed letters in the Federalist papers?
Bayesian methods
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the goal of probabilistic language models discussed in the lecture?
The goal is to assign a probability to a sentence.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the goal of probabilistic language modeling?
The goal is to compute the probability of a sentence or sequence of words.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
How can we compute the joint probability of a sequence of words using the Chain Rule of Probability?
We can compute the joint probability of a sequence of words using the Chain Rule by multiplying the individual probabilities of each word given the previous words in the sequence.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Why might it be challenging to accurately predict the next word in a sentence based on the given text 'No! Too many possible sentences!'?
It might be challenging because there are too many possible combinations and variations of sentences that could follow the given text.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are the two kinds of chatbots discussed in the lecture?
The two kinds of chatbots discussed in the lecture are Conversational agents and Task-based Dialogue Agents.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Which chatbot architecture was the first system to pass the Turing Test?
A mental model (PARRY) was the first system to pass the Turing Test.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is a formal language used for specifying text strings?
Regular expressions
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are the two kinds of errors discussed in the lecture regarding Regular Expressions?

The two kinds of errors discussed are: 1. Matching strings that should not have been matched (false positives or Type I errors) and 2. Not matching things that should have been matched (false negatives or Type II errors).
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are the two antagonistic efforts involved in reducing the error rate for an application?

The two antagonistic efforts involved in reducing the error rate for an application are increasing accuracy or precision (minimizing false positives) and increasing coverage or recall (minimizing false negatives).
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is word embedding in the context of NLP?

Word embedding is a term used for the representation of word meaning for text analysis, typically in the form of a real-valued vector that encodes the meaning of the word such that the words that are closer in the vector space are expected to be similar in meaning.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
According to the lecture, what is the meaning of 'dog' in the context of Computer Vision classification?
DOG
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the meaning component of a word according to the lecture material?
A sense or concept
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What tool is introduced in the video for corpus linguistics?
SketchEngine web tool
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are some of the functions of SketchEngine mentioned in the lecture segment?

Some of the functions of SketchEngine mentioned in the lecture segment include Word sketch summary, Concordance examples, Distributional Thesaurus, Parallel corpus creation, and Part-of-Speech tagging.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What is the purpose of the SketchEngine web tool mentioned in the lecture segment?
The SketchEngine web tool is used for corpus linguistics.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are word embeddings and what is their significance in natural language processing?

Word embeddings are numerical vector representations of word meanings. They are significant in natural language processing as they capture semantic relationships between words and are used in various NLP tasks such as language modeling, document classification, and machine translation.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
Where can you find word2vec code and the associated research paper?

You can find the word2vec code on Google code archive at code.google.com/archive/p/word2vec/ and the research paper in the document titled Efficient Estimation of Word Representations in Vector Space by Mikolov.
You are a factual chatbot that will help univserity students learn about the COMP2121 Data Mining module
What are the key components of an AI research paper, as mentioned in the lecture segment?
The key components of an AI research paper include research aims & objectives, background related research, methods, programme of research work, conclusions, and results.

Who is attributed with the classification of 8 parts of speech in the 1st century BCE?
Dionysius Thrax of Alexandria
